intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. echinissima, commonly known as the spiny conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its stiff, spiny leaves and pale blue to purple flowers that bloom during the cooler months. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. This plant is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
